input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Supervisor

Location: Westford, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title

Maintenance Supervisor

Job Description Summary

The Maintenance Supervisor is responsible for the overall maintenance, operation, and cleaning of the account

Job Description

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides oversight of all C&W Services Maintenance and Custodial operationsOversees major repairs and renovations of mechanical systemsOversees plant maintenance, operations activities and building renovationsPresides at weekly scheduling meetings and reconciles the maintenance requirements of individual areas so facility maintenance needs are metEnsures all work performed under his/her supervision is done in a timely and cost effective manner according to the applicable codesEnsures all facilities under his/her responsibility are safe and comply with all federal, state and local lawsAssists in reviewing and engineering, with the customer representative(s), any plans or specifications for additional maintenance, construction and renovationsDeliver facility and operations products and services at a high level.Develop and manage operating and capital budgets.Develop and maintain department emergency response procedures.Execution of site wide preventive maintenance programs.Oversee and operate site CMMS and EMS controlsDevelop, deploy and manage site Key Performance Indicators.Generate monthly productivity report for customer.

#INDCWS 

Requirements

Computer proficient, with working knowledge of Microsoft OfficeExcellent customer service, managerial, communication, and technical skillsWorking hours are not confined to weekdays, may also include evenings and weekends as well as on-call for emergency situationsExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact effectively at all levelsExperience managing a facility with a building automation systemAbility to effectively communicate to customer and subordinatesAbility to develop and manage the facility operationâ€™s budgetMust be able to work with co-workers in a professional and non-confrontational manner

C&W Services is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position at Cushman & Wakefield, please call the ADA line at 1-888-365-5406 or email HRServices@cushwake.com. Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

job_responsibilities: Provides oversight of all C&W Services Maintenance and Custodial operations
Oversees major repairs and renovations of mechanical systems
Oversees plant maintenance, operations activities and building renovations
Presides at weekly scheduling meetings and reconciles the maintenance requirements of individual areas so facility maintenance needs are met
Ensures all work performed under his/her supervision is done in a timely and cost effective manner according to the applicable codes
Ensures all facilities under his/her responsibility are safe and comply with all federal, state and local laws
Assists in reviewing and engineering, with the customer representative(s), any plans or specifications for additional maintenance, construction and renovations
Deliver facility and operations products and services at a high level
Develop and manage operating and capital budgets
Develop and maintain department emergency response procedures
Execution of site wide preventive maintenance programs
Oversee and operate site CMMS and EMS controls
Develop, deploy and manage site Key Performance Indicators
Generate monthly productivity report for customer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
